If you're looking for something a bit more action-packed, I'd recommend "Shattered". It's a gripping thriller that takes place in Europe, with a great cast including Gerard Butler and Tom Berenger. The plot is full of twists and turns, keeping you on the edge of your seat!

I think you might enjoy "Her" (2013) - it's a thought-provoking exploration of what it means to be human, set in a futuristic world where technology has changed the way we interact with each other. The film features Scarlett Johansson as the voice of an operating system designed to meet your every need, and explores themes of loneliness, connection, and what makes us truly human.

Alternatively, if you're in the mood for something a bit more action-packed, "Paycheck" (2003) might be up your alley. It's a fun, fast-paced thriller about a man who wakes up with no memory of who he is or why he's being chased - and it stars Ben Affleck as the protagonist trying to unravel the mystery!

It's a fascinating and suspenseful film with great performances from Benedict Cumberbatch and the rest of the cast.

This epic historical drama stars Mel Gibson as William Wallace, a Scottish warrior who leads a rebellion against English rule. With its themes of freedom, sacrifice, and loyalty, it's no wonder this film has become a classic.

If you're looking for something a bit more recent, Three Kings (1999) might be up your alley. This action-packed war drama stars George Clooney and Mark Wahlberg as two soldiers who, along with their team, stumble upon a vast treasure in Iraq after the Gulf War. With its blend of humor, adventure, and social commentary, it's a thought-provoking and entertaining ride.
